body.p: In evaluating the likely effects of permitting rate-regulated entities that are first-time adopters of IFRS to continue to recognise regulatory deferral account balances, the IASB has considered the following factors:

li.p: how the changes to the presentation of regulatory deferral account balances affect the financial statements of a rate-regulated entity;

whether the changes improve the comparability of financial information between different reporting periods for a rate-regulated entity and between different rate-regulated entities in a particular reporting period;
whether the changes improve the quality of financial information that is available to investors and its usefulness in assessing the future cash flows of a rate‑regulated entity;
whether users will benefit from better economic decision-making as a result of improved financial reporting;
the likely effect on compliance costs for preparers, both on initial application and on an ongoing basis; and
whether the likely costs of analysis for users are affected.
